dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1099 IH: Consistent Legal Expectations and Access to Records Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Scholten (for herself, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Min, and Mr. Mfume) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To clarify the applicability of the Freedom of Information Act to certain federally established entities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Consistent Legal Expectations and Access to Records Act or the CLEAR Act.

section.header: Application of the freedom of information act to certain federally established entities

subsection.text: Section 552(f)(1) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting after in the Executive Office of the President the following: , and any entity established under section 3161 of this title.

The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to any request made under section 552 of title 5, United States Code, on or after the date of enactment of this Act, regardless of when the records requested were created.
